reviews.review_msg: I rarely rate my profs here. But Brian is an exception... His teaching style is absolutely disorganized and he can laugh for no reason all of a sudden. The only advantage of this is that he provides a study guide before exams. So if you have to take a class with Brain, be ready to teach yourself (that was basically what I did).

His exams were really easy; he gave out the questions in advance so we would know what would be on there and prepare our answers. I personally did not find his lectures as helpful, but the tutorials were much better for my understanding of each topic.

Brian seems like a nice guy and I like how he incorporated real events into lectures and assignments. However, his slides are very dense and his lecture style is tough to follow as he likes to ramble and offten mumbles to himself.

Worst prof I've ever had. incoherent lectures, abandons thoughts half way through speech so hard to take notes. text dense unclear slides. forgot to tell school he wanted a final exam so it wasn't on the exam schedule and he instead announced it 3 weeks before end of term. Assignment prompts are unclear with 5 run on sentences in a row.
Nice guy but he mumbles during lectures and is really hard to understand.

Brian is a good person. However, he is very odd, and his lectures are very dull. He is very hard to understand. He mumbles to himself, he laughs at his own jokes, and I think he has an asthma problem. Try not to take this course. I thought I did pretty well but I basically taught myself.

Terrible teacher ever. I wish I could back in time and drop out of this course. I had a high GPA and now my GPA dropped because of this awful teacher who never tells you what he wants. He posts lectures after the exams!!! 

He is completely out of his mind and does not know anything about teaching.
Awful
Terrible

Worst teacher possible - disorganized- exams are way too difficult and completely different from what you study - post exams very late and never give you any feedback on your work. 

Stay away at any cost

Brian is hard to understand, but class is super easy. The questions on review guides were exact questions on midterm + final (easy to answer if took as many notes as possible in class + check lec slides). He likes quantity over quality. if you show up a couple times in tut, he will always mark you present. Overall easy class if you pay attention.

Please save yourself and do not take a class with Brian Thomas. Lectures were long and boring and I would not understand anything that Brian was saying. He mumbles and laughs to himself a a lot. Your best friend is the review guide for the midterm and final. Just pray that you get a good TA.

Brian Thomas is just a terrible at teaching. He mumbles when he speaks which makes it difficult to understand and he does care to record lectures. He rambles and gets off topic and the lectures are terribly formatted. The only positive thing is that he provided review guides for the midterm and the final.

This is for POL151. Brian is incredibly knowledgeable about the content, but is not suited to be a professor. Slides are wall of text, and he goes on esoteric tangents incomprehensible to first year students. The assignments and course load are fair but he doesn't post grades on Canvas, so you're left in the dark about what you've got in the class.

Choose any other elective! Lectures are long, boring and not well structured. Extremely difficult to know what the important content was to take notes on or to study. Major subjective grading discrepancies between the TA/Prof due to no rubrics for papers. Individual assignment grades were never returned - no opportunity to get feedback or improve.

Brian is incompetent at teaching-period. This class unnecessarily stressed me out. AVOID any class with him at all costs!! He's the most disorganized, chaotic, rambling, unapproachable, boring lecturer. Unclear grading criteria was super confusing for assignments, and NO grades were ever posted-just a final subjective letter grade at the end. Run!

Avoid this!! Way too difficult for an elective. Brian was often hard to understand, lectures were long, boring, and he goes through the slides too quickly to take good notes. Everyone got awful grades.

Horrible professor - totally unapproachable. He was late every class. Disorganized lectures that are disconnected from his slide content and totally random tangents. No rubric for the essay - grades were very low - very unclear and confusing instructions. Avoid this class!

I don't why people rate this prof so badly. But he is an amazing prof, the content is easy. The course has a lot of content to cover and understand, but he doesn't over complicate stuff and gives you a clear criteria on what he will be testing. The grading scheme is very straight forward. I would highly recommend. Good luck !!

The laziest prof Ive ever taken a class with. Essay grades were very low, (highest in the class was a B+), and was given back to us near the end of the semester. We still dont have our midterm grades, and we have already submitted the final. Students ask him every week for grades and he assures they will be back the next week, yet they never are.

He is very disorganized and easily distracted. Mumbles a lot while talking making it difficult to pay attention to. Lots of reading required for his class but attendance was not mandatory. Did not communicate his expectations for the term paper. Very slow at marking. I just submitted my take-home final and still don't have my midterm grade.

One of the worst profs ever. no matter how hard i tried i couldn't pay attention in class due to his constant mumbling, rambling and tongue clicking. he focused on discussion and not teaching the material. He was an extremely tough grader for the paper and uploaded everything late. Now i am trying to write the final without knowing my midterm grade

Nice guy, but the class was a trainwreck. Taught this class through (lots of) readings and live lectures, which were uploaded after the class. Partway through the term, started uploading them late. Gets distracted, mumbles sometimes. Didn't give much criteria for the paper, marked hard (and took a long time). Take-home final released late too.

Probably the worst professor I've ever had. Extremely disorganized to the point where the class was just stressful despite the material being quite simple and easy to grasp. The material itself is a lot of fun to learn, but this was one of the most stressful classes I've ever taken due to the lack of proper organization and communication.

Professor Brian Thomas was the worst prof I have ever had. There is virtually no structure to his course (POL 210), the TA did the majority of grading, and we never knew what the professor looked like. Professor Thomas lecture videos were hard to watch due to rambling and the occasional sniffling and we didnt get our grade back on our final essay

Lectures were difficult to follow. No rubric or grading criteria was offered, which made assignments and written exams incredibly difficult. Overall, it ended up fine, but prepare to be confused and frustrated.

He mumbles a lot during lecture and tends to ramble off topic (its hard to listen to live 2-3 hr lectures) He would usually forget to record them until he notices the students trying to tell him. Not the best with tech, which sucks when all classes are held online. you'll need to listen to lecture to understand his slides bc they're disorganized.

Doesn't seem to care about the class, seems very bored during lecture, checks and replies to emails during lecture. Decided to stop recording lectures without telling anyone because he found it "extremely disrespectful" that students weren't showing up anymore, after we asked. During covid. I really dont understand how he could take that personally

It seemed like the class only entered his mind when he was supposed to be teaching it. He never remembers to start recording lecture, and doesn't check the chat at all (people telling him to record or let them into the lecture). He talks VERY slowly, goes on unrelated tangents, and pauses constantly. I've learned more about his dog than philosophy.

Took this class summer 2020 semester during covid remote learning. Worst "teaching" I have ever experienced. The class was taught asynchronously, which allowed him to get by without interacting with students, posting lectures irregularly and always late, ignoring student concerns and emils. Assignments marks were released after classes were over.

WORST PROF EVER, DONT TAKE HIS CLASS ONLINE. Didn't respond to any emails for weeks-some not at all, uploaded 2 weeks worth of lecture 2 DAYS BEFORE THE MIDTERM, didn't tell us when he was dropping the midterm and gave barely any guidelines. This was a summer session class and he released more than half the course work in the last 2 weeks. Regret.

Do not take a class with this guy. He disappeared for two weeks during a condensed class. Doesn't provide dates on the syllabus, doesn't give criteria for assignments, drops assignments with little time to complete, doesn't respond to emails, lectures are useless are do not prepare you to be able fulfill assignment requirements, hacks and coughs

Worst prof ever. Class was online. Constantly posted late lectures. No clear grading criteria. No dates on syllabus. Midterm was dropped on us out of no where, with only 5 days to do it. I cannot stress enough how horrible he is at online classes. DO NOT TAKE HIM, EVER!

Please just don't take anything with him. Slides are disorganized, midterm was disorganized, he mumbles to himself during lecture. If you have to, try and get through class and just study the textbook, it's genuinely much more exciting and interesting. Memorize the notes for the exams.

He tries his best but this class gave me so much anxiety. I had to constantly chase him for criteria and feedback. I learned more about the concepts through readings than his lecture. Gave unrealistic criteria for short assignments (he wants a miracle paper but not to read it) & ALWAYS last minute after we had to remind him.
A great teacher but could use more organization but overall entertaining lecturer and a fair marker.
i rather let thomas THE TRAIN be my lecturer

absolutely DRY and are some of the most boring one can attend. On top of absolutely dry lectures, Brian's grading criteria is amongst the most confusing anyone has ever seen-- he doesn't even let you know the basis you're grades on and where marks would apply. I would steer clear of him

He is extremely respectful and helpful. His courses do require a bit of reading, but he will never ask you anything from outside of the assigned readings. He usually gives you a study guide to help you study for the final or midterm, which helps you know your areas of focus. He is not an efficient marker, will not deduct marks for tiny errors.

Brian doesnt give your typical note structured lecture. I find that as long as you actually do the readings and have a general familiarity with the course content (In a 300 level course... you should know enough yourself...) you do absolutely fine. Lecture is more about discussing content than learning it. Enjoyed his class very much

His lectures are very disorganized and hard to follow. Writes everything on the board and has very little to do with the material on the exam. He seems to know what he is talking about but does not give enough information on the readings in lecture. I would avoid taking another class with him

Super disorganized. Never post anything online which sucks cuz he writes everything on the board. He mumbles to himself and is not very clear on the material. Posted the final exam review guide a couple days before the actual exam. Will definitely avoid taking his class from now on. Good luck my friends.

Brian is super disorganized. He did not follow the course description and he gave us vague criteria for the essays like a week before they were due. The lectures were boring and he also he never mentioned what to expect on the exams in class. Instead he posted a review online like a few days before. Overall he was a bad prof and ruined the class

He knows what he's talking about and is able to give you ample amounts of info during lecture. A little unorganized, so don't be surprised if your study guide comes to you a day before the test. Overall, a great prof and I would take a class from him again anytime!

Seems passionate about what he is teaching but mumbles to himself and speaks in intonations making it difficult to understand. Focuses only on what he is teaching and doesn't stimulate class discussion. Gave me the vibe that he really doesn't care for his students. I would advise anyone else to stay away from this prof, really. THAK GOD FOR TAs!!

Brian is very disorganized. His slides are a mess, he uploads review guides and slides 1-3 days before the exam (but it is nice that he makes a review guide and his homework is simple), he makes errors in the syllabus about the rights chapters, errors in the exam outline about the day and time, doesn't reply to emails. Smart but not a great prof

Can be passionate about his topic, but due to this he'll talk very fast and often mumble to himself. It's hard to understand what he's saying or the main point he's teaching. He often stares at the ground or the desk when he's talking and doesn't upload lecture slides until right around exam season. I felt I could've enjoyed POL more w/ a diff prof

He is very passionate and smart but he is super unclear as a teacher and you have to read TONS for each week. He makes me not enjoy the material that I otherwise enjoy. I thought I could tackle a this course with him but it was just such a bad decision.

He was very clear about what he wanted for his papers and the exams. His classes were always fun to participate in, He articulated the material very clearly and I never lost focus. Our tutorial debates were very enjoyable and he is encouraging and provides a comfortable space for participation.
Best prof I've ever had. He loves laughing at comments he makes during class. Dresses real snazzy and looks just like Malcolm X.
Best poli sci prof at sfu

Horrible professor. Unpunctual, disorganized and distracted during lectures. Get ready for him to discuss trump and mention a sentence about stuff you need to learn. Boring lectures, mostly mumbles, very difficult to make organized notes in his class. Doesnt use canvas, so all PowerPoints are put 2 days before exams.

Brian is a nice guy, but when when it comes to teaching- he is not the best. Yes, he knows the material, but he cannot communicate it effectively at all. Like others have mentioned, he is very unclear, unpunctual, and disorganized-our due dates were changed so many times I lost track. On top of that, he hardly replies to any emails.

Sometimes late to class, often went over time, midterm was straightforward but didn't tell us why we got things wrong, lots of reading that he doesn't remind you about (check syllabus at least once a week), changed the term paper due date twice but his feedback on our first copies was pretty good. Get ready to debate in tutorials!

Brian is a very fun and humble prof. With the midterm, it was a bit hard for me since he didn't specify why some answers weren't right and he'd just cross over them. But for the paper he gives a lot of time and multiple chances to improve your grade. He's very accessible through phone outside of the class. Tutorial attendance isn't mandatory.
really confusing, made a lot of jokes, not a good class

Brian is an okay prof. TBH, without the TA Alexandra, I wouldnt have passed the course. He digresses a lot  and doesn't give clear notes in class. The exams are exactly the same as the Review Guides he posted. The reading were a lot, but I learned so much from this course (more from TA Alex than Brian). He is funny and makes discussions interesting

Didn't purchase the textbooks and still ended up with an easy A. The midterm and final are the exact same questions as the reviews he posted on canvas. He is a sloppy writer though and his notes aren't very linear.

His teaching style consisted of him scribbling across the board and talking in no way any students could understand. Did not explain concepts well at all. Textbook heavy; tests directly on the texts even though he does not mention it. Both midterm and final had things we had not learned that semester. Always late; forgot students' papers often.

midterm and final had a lot of stuff we never learned. Assigned readings every week, never mentioned them in class but they are testable. Takes time marking papers and if you're one of the few that doesn't get theirs marked on time he tells you to come to his office hours to pick it up but doesn't show up himself so you waste a trip to campus

Brian Thomas writes on the board rather than use power point or any type common technology. This makes it difficult to read and follow along, and also wastes a lot of class time. Part of me thinks that he writes on the board just to fill the entire time slot. Felt like I was wasting my time in class

He makes you work for your grade. When he says to read and re-read the material, then do it. The course content he specializes in is theoretical politics -- meaning that the stuff you learn isn't all so easy. Sure, he's disorganized while in lecture, but if you do the readings prior to the class, then you'll know what's going on without a doubt.
Great prof!

Brian probably is a nice guy. But the problem is that he  doesn't use powerpoints so he writes all over the whiteboard in a very disorganized fashion. His writing isn't neat either so that sucks. He has no concept of time, showing up late and going over time with unnecessary material. His exams are nothing like what he says. BEWARE AND WATCH OUT.
Was usually late to class and disorganized and jumped everywhere with lectures. But exams were super easy and based off lectures and readings, and marked papers easy too.
Gives the impression that your time isn't worth anything by being late to EVERY class.  Very very disorganized and gives the impression that he likes to hear himself talk.  Avoid at all cost.

Brian was not a good prof. He was continually late to every class, and his lectures were very hard to follow. They weren't well related to the readings, but the exam is heavily focused on the readings. He is disorganized (especially with marking). He doesn't have a clear marking scheme; he seems to make it up as he goes.

Brian Thomas is a professor who half heartedly attempts his work. His extreme disorganization and lack of clarity result in it being extremely difficult to learn what is being taught. I took his political philosophy class and learned more from spark notes than his lectures. Notes are vague and lack in detail that is expected in the class.

Probably the most unclear prof I've had in the past 3 years. Doesn't like answering questions about exams or essays, if he provides any information it's within days of the due date. Seems irritated by any inquiries made and doesn't make an effort to interact with students. It's clear that he only comes to class to listen to himself talk.

1)Friendly and helpful 2)Writes all notes VERY DISORGANIZED way ON THE WHITE BOARD ALL THE TIME 3)No use of Canvas, contacts you way too late about essay/exam 4)Too much of exam is based on readings which you have to trek to the library to get or find, btw he is very vague on how to get them. 5)Late ALL the time tip: research on ur own for exam!!

By far one of the worst profs I've ever had. Completely disorganized, always shows up to class at least 10 minutes late. His notes follow no sort of order or flow and most of the time are not related to the textbook at all. Gives absolutely no feedback on exams and his marking is unjustified. It is clear he does not care at all for his students.

Brian is funny and is extremely talkative but the material he covers in class barely resembles the reading material and the material he does test you on are only based on the textbook. His lectures are long, boring, unorganized, and confusing.

Awesome prof. It's hard to follow what he says on class because it's tripping sometimes. Rather than that, notes are extremely helpful and the readings are important to follow the lecture. Big disposition to help. Very unique teacher but awesome guy that wants the students to succeed if they deserve and work hard to achieve it.

Although Brian is a funny professor his lectures lack structure. He's not good with technology and doesn't provide ppts, instead writes on the board in an unorganized fashion. I enjoyed him for the first couple of classes, but studying for exams was hard since his lecture notes did nothing for me. Try avoiding him for someone with better notes.
Awesome professor! I was not looking forward to taking political philosophy, but he made this class super interesting! He is so funny! Definitely taking another class with him again. Loved the class!

Nice guy, very helpful when needed, but lectures tended to be very dry (in large part thanks to the material, not his fault).  He tries a little too hard to be "risqu√©" at times, in an attempt to win over the young, but knows the material well. Overall a rewarding course, and he's a decent prof. He could incorporate a little more interaction.

Very smart and funny. Professor Thomas is interesting and very straight forward. He is so chill! You do however need to read the material but trust me you want to the debates with this guy are out of this world. Really changed my mind of a couple of things. Super smart and funny - take him you won't regret it!
